intro: Lasallea walteri, commonly known as the Walter's lasallea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and botanical study.
